packageInfo.title: Pipeline definition sanity checks
packageInfo.description:
Currently there is just a check to confirm the input
appears to be a Pipeline definition. We may add additional
sanity checks in future.

policy.pipeline.basic.title: Input data has unexpected kind
policy.pipeline.basic.description: A sanity check to confirm the input data has the kind "Pipeline"

packageInfo.title: Required tasks
packageInfo.description:
HACBS expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds.
This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition
includes the required Tekton tasks.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: No tasks in Pipeline
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description:
This policy enforces that at least one Task is present in the Pipeline
definition.
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.failureMsg: No tasks found in Pipeline definition

packageInfo.title: Required tasks
packageInfo.description:
HACBS expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds.
This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition
includes the required Tekton tasks.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: Missing required task
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description:
This policy enforces that the required set of tasks are included
in the Pipeline definition.

packageInfo.title: Required tasks
packageInfo.description:
HACBS expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds.
This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition
includes the required Tekton tasks.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: Missing future required task
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description:
This policy warns when a task that will be required in the future
was not included in the Pipeline definition.
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.failureMsg: Task %q is missing and will be required in the future

packageInfo.title: Required tasks
packageInfo.description:
HACBS expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds.
This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition
includes the required Tekton tasks.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: Missing required tasks data
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description: The policy rules in this package require the required-tasks data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle was not used or is not defined
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description:
Check for existence of a task bundle. Enforcing this rule will
fail the contract if the task is not called from a bundle.
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' does not contain a bundle reference

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle reference is empty
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description: Check for a valid task bundle reference being used.
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' uses an empty bundle image reference

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Unpinned task bundle reference
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description:
Check if the Tekton Bundle used for the Tasks in the Pipeline definition
is pinned to a digest.
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' uses an unpinned task bundle reference '%s'

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle is out of date
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description:
Check if the Tekton Bundle used for the Tasks in the Pipeline definition
is the most recent acceptable one. See the list of acceptable
task bundles at xref:acceptable_bundles.adoc#_task_bundles[Acceptable Bundles] or look at
xref:attachment$acceptable_tekton_bundles.yml[data/acceptable_tekton_bundles.yml]
in this git repository. The meaning of an acceptable bundle is explained in
xref:acceptable_bundles.adoc#_task_bundles[Acceptable Bundles]
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' uses an out of date task bundle '%s'

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle is not acceptable
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description:
Check if the Tekton Bundle used for the Tasks in the Pipeline definition
are acceptable given the tracked effective_on date. See the list of acceptable
task bundles at xref:acceptable_bundles.adoc#_task_bundles[Acceptable Bundles] or look at
xref:attachment$acceptable_tekton_bundles.yml[data/acceptable_tekton_bundles.yml]
in this git repository. The meaning of an acceptable bundle is explained in
xref:acceptable_bundles.adoc#_task_bundles[Acceptable Bundles]
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' uses an unacceptable task bundle '%s'

packageInfo.title: Task bundle
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Missing required data
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description: The policy rules in this package require the task-bundles data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Attestation type
packageInfo.description: Sanity checks related to the format of the image build's attestation.

policy.release.attestation_type.title: Unknown attestation type found
policy.release.attestation_type.description:
A sanity check to confirm the attestation found for the image has a known
attestation type.

packageInfo.title: Attestation type
packageInfo.description: Sanity checks related to the format of the image build's attestation.

policy.release.attestation_type.title: Missing pipelinerun attestation
policy.release.attestation_type.description: At least one PipelineRun attestation must be present.

packageInfo.title: Authorization
packageInfo.description:
This package contains rules to check that the image is signed-off
for release. There are different ways of providing that sign-off
authorization.

TODO: Document the ways that release authorization can be provided.

policy.release.authorization.title: Authorization does not exist
policy.release.authorization.description: Enterprise Contract verifies if the build was authorized

packageInfo.title: Authorization
packageInfo.description:
This package contains rules to check that the image is signed-off
for release. There are different ways of providing that sign-off
authorization.

TODO: Document the ways that release authorization can be provided.

policy.release.authorization.title: Authorized commit does not match
policy.release.authorization.description: Enterprise Contract verifies if an authorized commit was used as the source of a build
policy.release.authorization.failureMsg: Commit %s does not match authorized commit %s

packageInfo.title: Authorization
packageInfo.description:
This package contains rules to check that the image is signed-off
for release. There are different ways of providing that sign-off
authorization.

TODO: Document the ways that release authorization can be provided.

policy.release.authorization.title: Authorized repo url does not match
policy.release.authorization.description: Enterprise Contract verifies if an authorized repo url was used to build an image
policy.release.authorization.failureMsg: Repo url %s does not match authorized repo url %s

packageInfo.title: Base image checks
packageInfo.description:
This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images
reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Restrict registry of base images
policy.release.base_image_registries.description:
The base images used when building a container image must come from a known set
of trusted registries to reduce potential supply chain attacks. This policy
defines trusted registries as registries that are fully maintained by Red Hat
and only contain content produced by Red Hat.
policy.release.base_image_registries.failureMsg: Base image %q is from a disallowed registry

packageInfo.title: Base image checks
packageInfo.description:
This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images
reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Base images must be provided
policy.release.base_image_registries.description:
The attestation must provide the expected information about which base images
were used during the build process.

packageInfo.title: Base image checks
packageInfo.description:
This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images
reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Missing rule data
policy.release.base_image_registries.description:
The policy rules in this package require the allowed_registry_prefixes
rule data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Buildah build task
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying the buildah build task

policy.release.buildah_build_task.title: Dockerfile param not included
policy.release.buildah_build_task.description: This policy verifies that there is a dockerfile parameter
policy.release.buildah_build_task.failureMsg: DOCKERFILE param is not included in the task

packageInfo.title: Buildah build task
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying the buildah build task

policy.release.buildah_build_task.title: Dockerfile param external source
policy.release.buildah_build_task.description: This policy verifies that the dockerfile is not an external source
policy.release.buildah_build_task.failureMsg: DOCKERFILE param value (%s) is an external source

packageInfo.title: Hermetic build task
packageInfo.description:
This package verifies the build task in the attestation was invoked
with the expected parameters to perform a hermetic build.

policy.release.hermetic_build_task.title: hermetic_build_task
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.description:
This policy verifies the build task in the PipelineRun attestation
was invoked with the proper parameters to make the build process
hermetic.
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.failureMsg: Build task was not invoked with hermetic parameter

packageInfo.title: Java dependency checks
packageInfo.description:
This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies
were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially
untrusted respositories.
The result must be reported by a Task that has been loaded from an
acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].
If the result is missing or provided via a task loaded from unacceptable no
issue is reported.

policy.release.java.title: Prevent Java builds from depending on foreign dependencies
policy.release.java.description:
The SBOM_JAVA_COMPONENTS_COUNT TaskResult finds dependencies that have
originated from foreign repositories, i.e. ones that are not rebuilt or
redhat.
policy.release.java.failureMsg: Found Java dependencies from '%s', expecting to find only from '%s'

packageInfo.title: Java dependency checks
packageInfo.description:
This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies
were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially
untrusted respositories.
The result must be reported by a Task that has been loaded from an
acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].
If the result is missing or provided via a task loaded from unacceptable no
issue is reported.

policy.release.java.title: Missing rule data
policy.release.java.description:
The policy rules in this package require the allowed_java_component_sources
rule data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a
developer’s workstation."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: Builder ID exists
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description: The attestation attribute predicate.builder.id is set.
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.failureMsg: Builder ID not set in attestation

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a
developer’s workstation."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: Build service used
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description:
The attestation attribute predicate.builder.id is set to one
of the values in data.rule_data.allowed_builder_ids, e.g.
"https://tekton.dev/chains/v2".

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of “build script”.
The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Build task contains steps
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description:
The attestation attribute predicate.buildConfig.tasks.steps is not
empty of the pipeline task responsible for building the image.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.failureMsg: Build task %q does not contain any steps

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of “build script”.
The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Build task missing
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description:
The attestations must contain a build task with the expected
IMAGE_DIGEST and IMAGE_URL results.

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of “build script”.
The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Mismatch subject
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description:
The subject of the attestations must match the IMAGE_DIGEST and
IMAGE_URL values from the build task.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.failureMsg: The attestation subject, %q, does not match the build task image, %q

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Provenance - Available
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA Provenance Available requirement states the following:

"The provenance is available to the consumer in a format that the consumer accepts. The
format SHOULD be in-toto SLSA Provenance, but another format MAY be used if both producer
and consumer agree and it meets all the other requirements."

This package only accepts the in-toto SLSA Provenance format.

policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.title: Attestation predicate type
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.description:
The predicateType field of the attestation must indicate the in-toto SLSA Provenance format
was used to attest the PipelineRun.
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.failureMsg: Attestation predicate type %q is not an expected type (%s)

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system
that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git,
Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built
from a git repository.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: Material format
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description:
At least one entry in the predicate.materials array of the attestation contains
the expected attributes: uri and digest.sha1.

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system
that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git,
Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built
from a git repository.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: Material from a git repository
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description:
Each entry in the predicate.materials array of the attestation uses
a git URI.
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.failureMsg: Material URI %q is not a git URI

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system
that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git,
Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built
from a git repository.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: Material with git commit digest
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description:
Each entry in the predicate.materials array of the attestation includes
a SHA1 digest which corresponds to a git commit.
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.failureMsg: Material digest %q is not a git commit

packageInfo.title: Step image registries
packageInfo.description:
This package contains a rule to ensure that each task in the image's
build pipeline ran using a container image from a known and presumably
trusted source.

policy.release.step_image_registries.title: Task steps ran on container images that are disallowed
policy.release.step_image_registries.description:
Enterprise Contract has a list of allowed registry prefixes. Each step in each
each TaskRun must run on a container image with a url that matches one of the
prefixes in the list.
policy.release.step_image_registries.failureMsg: Step %d in task '%s' has disallowed image ref '%s'

packageInfo.title: Step image registries
packageInfo.description:
This package contains a rule to ensure that each task in the image's
build pipeline ran using a container image from a known and presumably
trusted source.

policy.release.step_image_registries.title: Missing rule data
policy.release.step_image_registries.description:
The policy rules in this package require the allowed_step_image_registry_prefixes
rule data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Task bundle checks
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happened during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks that built the image were defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles used are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.title: Task bundle was not used or is not defined
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.description:
Check for existence of a task bundle. Enforcing this rule will
fail the contract if the task is not called from a bundle.
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' does not contain a bundle reference

policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.title: Task bundle reference is empty
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.description: Check for a valid task bundle reference being used.
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.failureMsg: Pipeline task '%s' uses an empty bundle image reference

packageInfo.title: Task bundle checks
packageInfo.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happened during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks that built the image were defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles used are from the list of known

policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.title: Missing required data
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.description: The policy rules in this package require the task-bundles data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Tasks
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included
in the pipeline build for each image to be released.
This package includes a set of rules to verify that the expected
tasks ran in the pipeline when the image was built.
Required tasks are listed by the names given to them within the Tekton
Bundle image. Optionally invocation parameter of a Task can be also
mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following
the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter
is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task
definition for each parameter seperately.
The Tasks must be loaded from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

policy.release.tasks.title: No tasks run
policy.release.tasks.description:
This policy enforces that at least one Task is present in the PipelineRun
attestation.
policy.release.tasks.failureMsg: No tasks found in PipelineRun attestation

packageInfo.title: Tasks
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included
in the pipeline build for each image to be released.
This package includes a set of rules to verify that the expected
tasks ran in the pipeline when the image was built.
Required tasks are listed by the names given to them within the Tekton
Bundle image. Optionally invocation parameter of a Task can be also
mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following
the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter
is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task
definition for each parameter seperately.
The Tasks must be loaded from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

policy.release.tasks.title: Missing required task
policy.release.tasks.description:
This policy enforces that the required set of tasks are included
in the PipelineRun attestation.

packageInfo.title: Tasks
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included

definition for each parameter seperately.
The Tasks must be loaded from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.

policy.release.tasks.title: Missing future required task
policy.release.tasks.description:
This policy warns when a task that will be required in the future
was not included in the PipelineRun attestation.
policy.release.tasks.failureMsg: Task %q is missing and will be required in the future

packageInfo.title: Tasks

mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following
the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter
is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task
definition for each parameter seperately.
The Tasks must be loaded from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

policy.release.tasks.title: Missing required tasks data
policy.release.tasks.description: The policy rules in this package require the required-tasks data to be provided.

packageInfo.title: Test
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

TODO: Document how you can skip the requirement for individual
tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.

policy.release.test.title: No test data found
policy.release.test.description:
None of the tasks in the pipeline included a HACBS_TEST_OUTPUT
task result, which is where Enterprise Contract expects to find
test result data.

packageInfo.title: Test
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

TODO: Document how you can skip the requirement for individual
tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.

policy.release.test.title: Test data is missing the results key
policy.release.test.description:
Each test result is expected to have a 'results' key. In at least
one of the HACBS_TEST_OUTPUT task results this key was not present.

packageInfo.title: Test
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

TODO: Document how you can skip the requirement for individual
tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.

policy.release.test.title: Unsupported result in test data
policy.release.test.description:
This policy expects a set of known/supported results in the test data
It is a failure if we encounter a result that is not supported.

packageInfo.title: Test
packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

TODO: Document how you can skip the requirement for individual
tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.

policy.release.test.title: Test result is FAILURE or ERROR
policy.release.test.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that all the tests in the test results
have a successful result. A successful result is one that isn't a
"FAILURE" or "ERROR". This will fail if any of the tests failed and
the failure message will list the names of the failing tests.
policy.release.test.failureMsg: The following tests did not complete successfully: %s

packageInfo.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.

policy.release.test.title: Some tests were skipped
policy.release.test.description: Collects all tests that have their result set to "SKIPPED".

packageInfo.description:

to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.

policy.release.test.title: Some tests returned a warning
policy.release.test.description: Collects all tests that have their result set to "WARNING".
policy.release.test.failureMsg: The following tests returned a warning: %s

policy.pipeline.basic.title: Pipeline definition sanity checks
policy.pipeline.basic.description:
Currently there is just a check to confirm the input
appears to be a Pipeline definition. We may add additional
sanity checks in future.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: Required tasks
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description:
HACBS expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds.
This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition
includes the required Tekton tasks.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.release.attestation_type.title: Attestation type
policy.release.attestation_type.description: Sanity checks related to the format of the image build's attestation.

policy.release.authorization.title: Authorization
policy.release.authorization.description:
This package contains rules to check that the image is signed-off
for release. There are different ways of providing that sign-off
authorization.

TODO: Document the ways that release authorization can be provided.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Base image checks
policy.release.base_image_registries.description:
This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images
reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.buildah_build_task.title: Buildah build task
policy.release.buildah_build_task.description: This package is responsible for verifying the buildah build task

policy.release.hermetic_build_task.title: Hermetic build task
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.description:
This package verifies the build task in the attestation was invoked
with the expected parameters to perform a hermetic build.

policy.release.java.title: Java dependency checks
policy.release.java.description:
This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies
were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially
untrusted respositories.
The result must be reported by a Task that has been loaded from an
acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].
If the result is missing or provided via a task loaded from unacceptable no
issue is reported.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a
developer’s workstation."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of “build script”.
The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was
built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.title: SLSA - Provenance - Available
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.description:
The SLSA Provenance Available requirement states the following:

"The provenance is available to the consumer in a format that the consumer accepts. The
format SHOULD be in-toto SLSA Provenance, but another format MAY be used if both producer
and consumer agree and it meets all the other requirements."

This package only accepts the in-toto SLSA Provenance format.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:

"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system
that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git,
Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."

This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built
from a git repository.

policy.release.step_image_registries.title: Step image registries
policy.release.step_image_registries.description:
This package contains a rule to ensure that each task in the image's
build pipeline ran using a container image from a known and presumably
trusted source.

policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.title: Task bundle checks
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.description:
To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important
to know exactly what happened during the build. To do this
Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of
known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to
confirm that the tasks that built the image were defined in task
bundles, and that the task bundles used are from the list of known
and trusted bundles.

policy.release.tasks.title: Tasks
policy.release.tasks.description:
Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included
in the pipeline build for each image to be released.
This package includes a set of rules to verify that the expected
tasks ran in the pipeline when the image was built.
Required tasks are listed by the names given to them within the Tekton
Bundle image. Optionally invocation parameter of a Task can be also
mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following
the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter
is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task
definition for each parameter seperately.
The Tasks must be loaded from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

policy.release.test.title: Test
policy.release.test.description:
Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected
to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package
includes a set of rules to verify that.

The rest result data must be reported by a Tekton Task that has been loaded
from an acceptable Tekton Bundle.
See xref:release_policy.adoc#attestation_task_bundle_package[Task bundle checks].

TODO: Document how you can skip the requirement for individual
tests if needed using the `non_blocking_rule` configuration.
